intro: Salvia oresbia, commonly known as the Mexican mint marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a perennial herb characterized by its aromatic, mint-scented leaves and vibrant purple or red tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties. Salvia oresbia is also popular in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
